definition: to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I hope to see my grandchildren in Australia before I turn up my toes .
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我翹辮子之前去澳大利亞看看我的孫子。

sentences.english: Didn't you hear ? He kicked the bucket. Had a heart attack , I think.
sentences.chinese: 你沒聽說吧？他翹辮子了。我想是因爲心臟病。

sentences.english: They keep one plane on permanent standby in case I should kick the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 他們有一架長期待命的飛機，在我翹辮子的時候用。

sentences.english: You never know when your time is up.
sentences.chinese: 你永遠不會知道自己什麼時候翹辮子。

sentences.english: Illusions of the, Love gone, What will you?
sentences.chinese: 我的心翹辮子，死走了，你呢？
